parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From hupo and meno; to stay under, i.e. Remain; figuratively, to undergo, i.e. Bear, have fortitude, persevere.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From paideuo; tutorage, i.e. Education or training; by implication, disciplinary correction.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and phero; to bear towards, i.e. Lead to, tender, treat.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
